Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> What if my kmd address is sprout?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's not automatic, you must import the privkey for that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Sprout really only is regarding zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> I'm using mobile agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> `What if my kmd address is sprout?` then your KMD is locked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zaddrs are not being airdropped

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you have funds in zaddrs, it will be worthless pretty soon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Sprout zaddrs are going away

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and our new chain will have Sapling zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I encourage everybody to use new Sapling zaddrs extensively and store funds in them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> only use taddrs for exchanges that don't support zaddrs (which is most right now, unfortunately)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but now zaddrs will be super fast, there is no reason not to use them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> our GUI wallets will teach users to use zaddrs by default

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and warn that taddrs are leaking private metadata

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> solo mining and exchanges will need taddrs for a while, but our mining pools will support sapling zaddrs!!! That is a big step

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> `our GUI wallets will teach users to use zaddrs by default`
_has one of those started, but it's not as shexy as yours_

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> all that glitters is not gold

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> I've still got a bit of C to learn to make it display right

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> @dukeleto , if I were to send my Hush to a KMD address that I access via Ledger, would that allow me to retrieve/send the Hush back to another address after, or is that not supported?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> https://tenor.com/view/nacho-why-confused-jack-black-gif-8714598

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> @ComputerGenie - ChickenPool LOL! Not all of them, just some for long term hodling. Just a question at this point though.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> My question was more about ledger than the coins.
They **still** don't properly support KMD (even with luke holding their hand all the way along), so I'm still slightly confused as to why anyone uses them at all.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> The last KMD Ledger app had big improvements, seems to work fine atm. The one downside is that the Rewards part is a bit cumbersome.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> `a bit cumbersome` aka `doesn't work`
sending a tx to yourself shouldn't be any more difficult than sending it to someone else

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Matthias i have never used a Ledger and I don't recommend involving a Ledger in your HUSH/KMD stuff, unless you want to find bugs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Ledger support has vastly improved lately in KMD, I know that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But I don't own one and don't really follow it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1117080630301528064

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> Understood, thanks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1117085437737230336

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we never had any money for that, but the FR now gives us the funds to do cool things like that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I forget how much he charges, what do people think is a reasonable amount to pay for such a book to be made?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> a book printed on dead trees will be outdated as soon as it is printed. Also, so many more people will be able to see it and find out about Hush. We could give out free copies to people as prizes. Call me old-fashioned, but I like the idea of printed books

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <btcrealm> Does this change to hush have anything to do with the BTCH chain?
I had a z-wallet I had to transfer out of for this update.  I'm guessing z-wallets didn't get BTCH anyway so probably no worries.  (yes, I am out of date and have not been paying attention lately)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiveBuddha> @DarkRealms nah it doesn't, but you made the right move taking out of zaddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiveBuddha> Because when the update rolls out you will get coins on the new chain. Once that snapshot happens you can go back to zaddr on the new chain. Someone can correct me if I'm wrong

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <btcrealm> @JiveBuddha thanks, I heard it wouldn't migrate if it was in zaddrs.  I just had it there because I was playing with it when radix42 needed an exchange.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <btcrealm> I will read the new white paper but is one of the goals of Hush still to do private secure messaging?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiveBuddha> I would also like clarification on what previous mission statements are still in the works. And what are the new ones

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <btcrealm> I'm guessing the new whitepaper will have details but I haven't gotten to it yet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiveBuddha> Whitepaper is a draft from my understanding, unless they shipped out a final version

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's still a drafty pre-release, but it does have a lot of details already

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> some details won't finalize until block 500,000 and the airdrop happens, then I can add all that data to the WP

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> FYI the airdrop will take some time, a few hours to potentially 24hrs to run. I expect to have all the finalized data for people to look at very soon after the snapshot block.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> about 31,000 addresses will be involved

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <btcrealm> Thanks @dukeleto for the update info

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> #hush-github also has all the gritty details

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the airdrop is a lot of waiting, because I can only send to a few hundred addresses at a time, in batches, and must wait for that to complete to send the next batch. No parallel processing in the airdrop, so it will be a series of batches. The next batch send needs to wait a bit for the previous xtn to confirm so it can spend the change that comes out of that transaction

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> in case people want to know more 🤓

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Currently `71324.99338207 HUSH` is in Sprout zaddrs and will not be migrated to our new blockchain, which is 1.13% of current supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> IF YOU HAVE FUNDS IN zaddrs, MOVE THEM ASAP, just over 300 blocks to go

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1117273266446655489

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> hopefully somebody sees that meme and saves their funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> is mining going to continue or will it be paused?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> mining pools will switch over pretty seemlessly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you are a solo miner, you can switch to the new network immediately, and I am working with various pools

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> and the payouts will go through fine?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> payouts will happen on the new chain, to the address you control on the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so pool miners should convert their workers to the new address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://dexstats.info/addressconverter.php

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you can choose FROM: HUSH TO: KMD on that form, and paste your address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> right but we have to wait for the airdrop?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you mine on the new chain, payouts will go to those addresses when pools payout

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> regardless of airdrop

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> Does the fork affect BTCH?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> airdrop funds must wait until airdrop completes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This does not effect BTCH in any way, we are catching up to BTCH having Sapling and cryptoconditions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and now HUSH + BTCH can do smart contracts across both chains, and interoperate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> before, they couldn't

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> Ok thanks. I’m pretty sure I have BTCH based on my HUSH keys.   Not really sure tbh.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> Just want to make sure I don’t miss something

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> save your wallet.dat's 😃

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> Yep.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> Ty!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 👍

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We around around 13ish hours from the snapshot block

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I urge people, do not make transactions very close to the snapshot block

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Things in the mempool, they are not on the blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The mempool is ignored in an airdrop

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> so I need to convert my address?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You will want to know your new address on the new HUSH chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you have the same pubkey

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but that pubkey maps to a different-looking address on the new chain, starts with an R...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> t1 -> R...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> can I mine to that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> once pools have switched to the new chain, you should use your R... address as your worker name, OR pool ops might auto-convert for you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but that is up to the pool op

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> these are good questions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Shivanshu> Hi. I just joined this group. Can some come one confirm if Cryptopia Hush coins will be migrate ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Shivanshu yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you don't need to do anything if your coins are on any exchange

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's only people with "shielded" coins in addresses starting with a "z"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> So it’s an ‘airdrop’ to the snapshot at 500k?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Shivanshu> Awesome.  When do we expect the snapshot ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We are upgrading our blockchain, mining a new genesis block, migrating funds to the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> snapshot is block 500,000, our new blockchain will actually start just before that and be ready for people to jump onto and mine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JWolf (WW Clan leader) yeah, good question. Mining seems ok I guess, but I recommend moving lots of your funds a few minutes before block 500,000

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I do recommend sweeping funds into as few addresses as you can, or just one

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It will make everything easier

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You want to import 1 or a few privkeys, not 1000s
